reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Minimize the adverse effects of transnational threats and criminal activities on the United States and its citizens, particularly when these activities involve cross-border connections or have cross-border effects. Promote international cooperation and coordination, and provide training and other technical assistance to help build institutional capacity for combating transnational threats including those to cybersecurity and international criminal activities such as corruption, alien smuggling, financial crimes (including money laundering), violations of intellectual property law, and cybercrime.

This award strives to minimize the adverse effects of transnational threats and criminal activies on the United States and its citizens, particularly when these activities involve cross-border connections or have cross-border effects. More specifically, this includes ECT technical assistance will aim to improve measures to prevent illicit financing from penetrating financial and commercial sectors; enforcement measures to address situations when preventative measures fall short; and to assist in FIU development, given the critical role the FIU plays in maximizing performance of preventative stakeholders; collecting financial intelligence from preventative stakeholders, analyzing it and disseminating value-added work product to enforcement stakeholders to support case development and successful prosecutions and asset recoveries. Additionally ECT will assist in promoting regional approaches and collaboration..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Strong partners for over five decades, Tanzania and the United States are working towards a shared vision of improving the quality of life for all Tanzanians. Despite its political stability and high levels of economic growth over the past two decades, roughly 28 percent of the population lives below the poverty line. The goal of U.S. assistance is to promote a healthy, prosperous, democratic, well-governed and secure Tanzania.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: International Affairs Technical Assistance, Executive Office of the President
